summary: The Internal Revenue Service relies on IT systems to collect taxes and distribute refunds. But many of these systems are aging. During fiscal year 2024, IRS spent about $1.5 billion to modernize systems that handle some of its most critical taxpayer services and business functions. These efforts aligned with IRS's strategic goals and for the most part followed best practices for documenting modernization plans. In...
title: Information Technology: IRS Is Developing a New Modernization Framework
